name: tert-butyl acrylate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison is n-butane, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the tert-butyl group increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, which raises the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The acrylate group introduces a carbonyl-like functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions.
